channel.title: Would it be possible (anti-advertiesment)
channel.description: To make it so that you can't have any links in the body of your post that doesn't sart with moparisthebest.com, and maybe someone could approve sites and then if you go to say moparisthebest.com/123(yoursite)efjndja then it will redirect. This is so poeple can't advertise there own sites without approval. in your sig, you oculd post any links though.

item.title: Would it be possible (anti-advertiesment)
item.dc:creator: @darkest_mage darkest_mage
item.description:
@darkest_mage wrote:

I could, if mopar would use it is a different story, ill give him a call tomorrow and ask him.

Read full topic

maybe you could make it.

item.title: Would it be possible (anti-advertiesment)
item.dc:creator: @darkest_mage darkest_mage
item.description:
@darkest_mage wrote:

mopar may not have the time to do it but it is ub3r easy, it wouldnt even need a mod… just add a php code to handle it and pull data from the SMF database… very easy, also you would have to make SMF save to the database.

Read full topic

u don’t understand. it is fore veryhting, so people don’t post links illegaly, not so you can have aa free redirection service…

item.title: Would it be possible (anti-advertiesment)
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

download? what would you need a download for plus, someone else could code it and mopar could make a group that is allowed to approve them.

item.title: Would it be possible (anti-advertiesment)
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“bobby, post:8, topic:66497”]huh white csatle?
I just mean that u pm a admin and the make it so that if you go moparisthebest.com/(title of site/file/whatever) then it will redirect you, and you gfget isnta warned if the body of your post contains a link that doesn’t start with moparistehbest.com[/quote]

Moparisthebest does not have enough time to do something like that. As Lothy said, it would not be worth the effort. And, as White Castle said, it is hard to manage a large list of downloads rather than approve a few in a message.

Read full topic

item.title: Would it be possible (anti-advertiesment)

item.description:
@bobby wrote:

huh white csatle?
I just mean that u pm a admin and the make it so that if you go moparisthebest.com/(title of site/file/whatever) then it will redirect you, and you gfget isnta warned if the body of your post contains a link that doesn’t start with moparistehbest.com

item.title: Would it be possible (anti-advertiesment)
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Think about it - maybe someone wants to upload something (ahem) “proprietary”, he would go to some upload site, or link to a torrent metafile. Sure, you could have a big list that contained what you could link to and what you couldn’t, but wouldn’t that be a little too cumbersome?

Read full topic

item.title: Would it be possible (anti-advertiesment)
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

bobby:

thanks for that. I am sure you oculd, but do you people think mopar would do this. do you think it is a good idea?

It’s not worth the effort. Most users are more then happy to comply with the rule - After all, it doesn’t take that long to message an admin. As for the occasions that people feel they’re above the rule, the topics are often quickly locked.

Read full topic

item.title: Would it be possible (anti-advertiesment)

item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

bobby:

To make it so that you can’t have any links in the body of your post that doesn’t sart with moparisthebest.com, and maybe someone could approve sites and then if you go to say moparisthebest.com/123(yoursite)efjndja then it will redirect. This is so poeple can’t advertise there own sites without approval. in your sig, you oculd post any links though.

Mopar would need mods for that, and since he seldom can apply them (since he’d need to do it on both forums, moparisthebest and moparscape), this probably won’t happen. Nice idea though.
